poem:
**A Moment in Time**

At twilight, the stage set,
satin-wrapped aspirations
in a mirrored room,
a whisper of power exchanged,
brief intersections—  
the nations' gaze averted.

In shame's decay,
truth lies bare, unblinking,
where dinner becomes
a fleeting shadow.

We are but pages,
marked and forgotten,
in history's relentless turn.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "‘The US lost its shame muscle’: why sex no longer scandalizes in politics Earlier this year, at Donald Trump’s hush-money trial, adult film star Stormy Daniels told jurors how at age 27, she met a 60-year-old Trump, whose wife had only recently given birth to their son, for what she thought was dinner. She arrived to find him in satin pyjamas and, during an encounter that included very “brief” sex, the business magnate told Daniels". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
news: ‘The US lost its shame muscle’: why sex no longer scandalizes in politics Earlier this year, at Donald Trump’s hush-money trial, adult film star Stormy Daniels told jurors how at age 27, she met a 60-year-old Trump, whose wife had only recently given birth to their son, for what she thought was dinner. She arrived to find him in satin pyjamas and, during an encounter that included very “brief” sex, the business magnate told Daniels
